label: 信牌
本: State and Diplomacy in Early Modern Japan: Asia in the Development of the Tokugawa Bakufu . Stanford University Press . 1991
説明文: [Passports required of] Chinese merchants coming to Nagasaki, issued on behalf of the bakufu by the Nagasaki Office of the Chinese Interpreters.  These credentials, employing language certain to be regarded as demeaning by Chinese officials, were dated in the Japanese calendar, and bore a split seal," very much like the trading tallies that Ming China had required of Japanese vessels wishing to trade on the China coast in the fifteenth and sixteenth centuries. "
